ebal_1026.name: Ebal (son of Shobal)
ebal_1026.bio: A descendant of Seir the Horite (Gen. 36:23).

ebal_2227.name: Ebal (Semite son of Joktan)
ebal_2227.bio: A descendant of Eber (1 Chr. 1:22), called also Obal (Gen. 10:28).

ebed_1027.name: Ebed (a servant; laborer)
ebed_1027.bio: Slave, the father of Gaal, in whom the men of Shechem "put confidence" in their conspiracy against Abimelech (Judg. 9:26, 26, 30, 31).

eber_1030.name: Eber (Heber)
eber_1030.bio: The third post-duluvian patriach after Shem (Gen. 10:24; 11:14). He is regarded as the founder of the Hebrew race (10:21; Num.

eber_1031.name: Eber (One of the seven heads of the families o)
eber_1031.bio: The oldest of the three sons of Elpaal the Benjamite (1 Chr. 8:12).

eber_1032.name: Eber (Amok Family Head)
eber_1032.bio: The head of the priestly family of Amok in the time of Zerubbabel (Neh. 12:20).

ebiasaph_19.name: Ebiasaph
ebiasaph_19.bio: Father of gathering; the gatherer, the youngest of the three sons of Korah the Levite, head of a family of Korhites (Ex. 6:24); called Ebisaph (1 Chr. 6:37).
children: Assir (The descendants of Kohath: Ebiasaph his)

eden_1033.name: Eden (the Levite)
eden_1033.bio: Son of Joah, and one of the Levites who assisted in reforming the public worship of the sanctuary in the time of Hezekiah (2 Chr. 29:12).

eder_1035.name: Eder
eder_1035.bio: The second of the three sons of Mushi, of the family of Merari, appointed to the Levitical office (1 Chr. 23:23; 24:30).

eglah_1036.name: Eglah
eglah_1036.bio: A heifer, one of David's wives, and mother of Ithream (2 Sam. 3:5; 1 Chr. 3:3).

eglon_1037.name: Eglon
eglon_1037.bio: Chieftain or king of one of the Moabite tribes (Judg. 3:12-14). Having entered into an alliance with Ammon and Amalek, he overran the trans-Jordanic region, and then crossing the Jordan, seized on Jericho, the "city of palm trees," which had been by this time rebuilt, but not as a fortress.

ehud_1039.name: Ehud (a left-handed man who was a deliverer)
ehud_1039.bio: The son of Gera, of the tribe of Benjamin (Judg. 3:15). After the death of Othniel the people again fell into idolatry, and Eglon, the king of Moab, uniting his bands with those of the Ammonites and the Amalekites, crossed the Jordan and took the city of Jericho, and for eighteen years held that whole district in subjection, exacting from it an annual tribute.
children: Naaman (commander of the army of the king of Ara)
Ahiah (high priest in the reign of Saul)

ehud_1040.name: Ehud (Second Judge of Israel)
ehud_1040.bio: A descendant of Benjamin (1 Chr. 7:10), his great-grandson.

elah_1043.name: Elah (A valley in the Shephelah)
elah_1043.bio: One of the Edomite chiefs or "dukes" of Mount Seir (Gen. 36:41).

elah_1044.name: Elah (One of the dukes of Edom)

elah_1045.name: Elah (Fourth king of Israel)
elah_1045.bio: The son and successor of Baasha, king of Israel (1 Kings 16:8-10). He was killed while drunk by Zimri, one of the captains of his chariots, and was the last king of the line of Baasha. Thus was fullfilled the prophecy of Jehu (6, 7, 11-14).

elah_1046.name: Elah (Hoshea´s father)
elah_1046.bio: The father of Hoshea, the last king of Israel (2 Kings 15:30; 17:1).
children: Hoshea (king in the twentieth year of Jotham son)

elah_1047.name: Elah (son of Caleb)
elah_1047.bio: The second of the three sons of Caleb, the son of Jephunneh (1 Chr. 4:15).
parents: Caleb (one of the twelve spies sent by Moses in)

elam_1049.name: Elam (civilization of antiquity)
elam_1049.bio: Highland, the son of Shem (Gen. 10:22), and the name of the country inhabited by his descendants (14:1, 9; Isa. 11:11; 21:2, etc.) lying to the east of Babylonia, and extending to the shore of the Mediterranean, a distance in a direct line of about 1,000 miles.

elam_1050.name: Elam (a headman of the tribe of Benjamin)

elasah_1055.name: Elasah (A son of Pashhur the priest; following t)

elasah_1056.name: Elasah (son of Shaphan)
elasah_1056.bio: The son of Shaphan, one of the two who were sent by Zedekiah to Nebuchadnezzar, and also took charge of Jeremiah's letter to the captives in Babylon (Jer. 29:3).

eldad_1058.name: Eldad
eldad_1058.bio: Whom God has loved, one of the seventy elders whom Moses appointed (Num. 11:26, 27) to administer justice among the people. He, with Medad, prophesied in the camp instead of going with the rest to the tabernacle, as Moses had commanded.

eleasah_1060.name: Eleasah (El)
eleasah_1060.bio: One of the descendants of Judah, of the family of Hezron (1 Chr. 2:39, "Eleasah").

eleasah_1061.name: Eleasah (son of Eshek)
eleasah_1061.bio: A descendant of king Saul (1 Chr. 8:37; 9:43).

eleazar_1062.name: Eleazar (Third son of Aaron)
eleazar_1062.bio: The third son of Aaron (Ex. 6:23). His wife, a daughter of Putiel, bore him Phinehas (Ex.

eleazar_1063.name: Eleazar (consecrated to keep the ark of the Lord)
eleazar_1063.bio: An inhabitant of Kirjath-jearim who was "sanctified" to take charge of the ark, although not allowed to touch it, while it remained in the house of his father Abinadab (1 Sam. 7:1, 2; comp. Num.

eleazar_1064.name: Eleazar (One of the three mighty warriors who str)
eleazar_1064.bio: The son of Dodo the Ahohite, of the tribe of Benjamin, one of the three most eminent of David's thirty-seven heroes (1 Chr. 11:12) who broke through the Philistine host and brought him water from the well of Bethlehem (2 Sam. 23:9, 16).

eleazar_1065.name: Eleazar (who had only daughters)
eleazar_1065.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari (1 Chr. 23:21, 22).

eleazar_1066.name: Eleazar (priest in the Hebrew)
eleazar_1066.bio: A son of Phinehas associated with the priests in taking charge of the sacred vessels brought back to Jerusalem after the Exile (Ezra 8:33).
parents: Phinehas (Eleazar son of Aaron married one of the)

eleazar_1069.name: Eleazar (The Second High Priest. Nephew of Moses)

elhanan_1070.name: Elhanan (The son of Jaare-oregim)
elhanan_1070.bio: A warrior of the time of David famed for his exploits. In the Authorized Version (2 Sam. 21:19) it is recorded that "Elhanan the son of Jaare-oregim, a Bethlehemite, slew the brother of Goliath." The Revised Version here rightly omits the words "the brother of." They were introduced in the Authorized Version to bring this passage into agreement with 1 Chr.

elhanan_1071.name: Elhanan (son of Dodo of Beth-lehem)
elhanan_1071.bio: The son of Dodo, and one of David's warriors (2 Sam. 23:24).

eli_1072.name: Eli
eli_1072.bio: Ascent, the high priest when the ark was at Shiloh (1 Sam. 1:3, 9). He was the first of the line of Ithamar, Aaron's fourth son (1 Chr.

eliab_1073.name: Eliab (Son of Helon)
eliab_1073.bio: A son of Helon, and chief of the tribe of Zebulun at the time of the census in the wilderness (Num. 1:9; 2:7).

eliab_1074.name: Eliab (Hebrew origin name)
eliab_1074.bio: A Reubenite, son of Pallu (Num. 16:1, 12; 26:8, 9; Deut. 11:6).

eliab_1076.name: Eliab (the son of Helon)
eliab_1076.bio: One of the Gadite heroes who joined David in his stronghold in the wilderness (1 Chr. 12:9).

eliada_1078.name: Eliada (Son of David)
eliada_1078.bio: One of David's sons born after his establishment in Jerusalem (2 Sam. 5:16).

eliada_1079.name: Eliada (One of David's sons born after his estab)
eliada_1079.bio: A mighty man of war, a Benjamite (2 Chr. 17:17).

eliadah_1080.name: Eliadah
eliadah_1080.bio: An Aramite of Zobah, captain of a marauding band that troubled Solomon (1 Kings 11:23).

eliakim_1084.name: Eliakim (Son of Melea)
eliakim_1084.bio: The son of Hilkiah, who was sent to receive the message of the invading Assyrians and report it to Isaiah (2 Kings 18:18; 19:2; Isa. 36:3; 37:2). In his office as governor of the palace of Hezekiah he succeeded Shebna (Isa.

eliakim_1087.name: Eliakim (son of Abihud)
eliakim_1087.bio: The son of Abiud, of the posterity of Zerubbabel (Matt. 1:13).

eliakim_1088.name: Eliakim (son of Simeon)
eliakim_1088.bio: The son of Melea (Luke 3:30), and probably grandson of Nathan.

eliam_1089.name: Eliam (father in law of David)
eliam_1089.bio: The father of Bathsheba, the wife of Uriah (2 Sam. 11:3). In 1 Chr.

eliam_1090.name: Eliam (Son of Ahithophel the Gilonite)
eliam_1090.bio: This name also occurs as that of a Gilonite, the son of Ahithophel, and one of David's thirty warriors (2 Sam. 23:34). perhaps these two were the same person.

eliashib_1093.name: Eliashib (El restores)
parents: Elioenai (the name of several minor characters in)

eliashib_1094.name: Eliashib (the twelfth to Jakim)
eliashib_1094.bio: A priest, head of one of the courses of the priests of the time of David (1 Chr. 24:12).

eliashib_1096.name: Eliashib (the High Priest is mentioned in Nehemiah)

eliashib_1098.name: Eliashib (A high priest in the days of Nehemiah)

eliashib_1100.name: Eliashib (descendant of Zattu)
eliashib_1100.bio: A high priest in the time of Ezra and Nehemiah (Neh. 12:22, 23). He rebuilt the eastern city wall (3:1), his own mansion being in that quarter, on the ridge Ophel (3:20, 21).

eliathah_1102.name: Eliathah
eliathah_1102.bio: To whom God will come, one of the foureen sons of the Levite Heman, and musician of the temple in the time of David (1 Chr. 25:4).

elidad_1103.name: Elidad
elidad_1103.bio: Whom God has loved, son of Chislon, and chief of the tribe of Benjamin; one of those who were appointed to divide the Promised Land among the tribes (Num. 34:21).

eliel_1104.name: Eliel (mighty warrior)
eliel_1104.bio: A chief of Manasseh, on the east of Jordan (1 Chr. 5:24).

eliel_1108.name: Eliel (A Gadite who joined David in the hold at)

eliel_1109.name: Eliel (My God is God)
eliel_1109.bio: A Gadite who joined David in the hold at Ziklag (1 Chr. 12:11).

eliel_1111.name: Eliel (Levite at time of Hezekiah)
eliel_1111.bio: One of the overseers of the offerings in the reign of Hezekiah (2 Chr. 31:13).

eliezer_1113.name: Eliezer (Steward of the house of Abram)
eliezer_1113.bio: "Of Damascus," the "steward" (R.V., "possessor") of Abraham's house (Gen. 15:2, 3). It was probably he who headed the embassy sent by Abraham to the old home of his family in Padan-aram to seek a wife for his son Isaac.

eliezer_1114.name: Eliezer (The third son of Aaron)
eliezer_1114.bio: One of the two sons of Moses, born during his sojourn in Midian (Ex. 18:4; 1 Chr. 23:15, 17).

eliezer_1115.name: Eliezer (son of Beker)
eliezer_1115.bio: The son of Becher, and grandson of Benjamin (1 Chr. 7:8).

eliezer_1116.name: Eliezer (the Priest)
eliezer_1116.bio: One of the priests who blew the trumpet before the ark when it was brought to Jerusalem (1 Chr. 15:24).

eliezer_1117.name: Eliezer (Tribe leader of the Reubenites)
eliezer_1117.bio: Son of Zichri, and chief of the Reubenites under David (1 Chr. 27:16).

eliezer_1118.name: Eliezer (son of Dodavahu of Mareshah)
eliezer_1118.bio: A prophet in the time of Jehoshaphat (2 Chr. 20:37). Others of this name are mentioned Luke 3:29; Ezra 8:16; 10:18, 23, 31.

eliezer_1120.name: Eliezer (descendant of Joshua son of Jozadak)

elihu_1126.name: Elihu (son of Jeroham)
elihu_1126.bio: The son of Tohu, and grandfather of Elkanah (1 Sam. 1:1). He is called also Eliel (1 Chr.

elihu_1127.name: Elihu (a man from the book of Job. Descended fr)
elihu_1127.bio: One of the captains of thousands of Manasseh who joined David at Ziklag (1 Chr. 12:20).

elihu_1128.name: Elihu (He is my God)
elihu_1128.bio: One of the family of Obed-edom, who were appointed porters of the temple under David (1 Chr. 26:7).
parents: Shemaiah (The eldest son of Obed-edom the Gittite.)

elihu_1130.name: Elihu (Friend of Job)
elihu_1130.bio: "The son of Barachel, a Buzite" (Job 32:2), one of Job's friends. When the debate between Job and his friends is brought to a close, Elihu for the first time makes his appearance, and delivers his opinion on the points at issue (Job 32-37).

elijah_1131.name: Elijah (a Tishbite who was an inhabitant of Gile)
elijah_1131.bio: "The Tishbite," the "Elias" of the New Testament, is suddenly introduced to our notice in 1 Kings 17:1 as delivering a message from the Lord to Ahab. There is mention made of a town called Thisbe, south of Kadesh, but it is impossible to say whether this was the place referred to in the name given to the prophet. Having delivered his message to Ahab, he retired at the command of God to a hiding-place by the brook Cherith, beyond Jordan, where he was fed by ravens.

elika_1133.name: Elika
elika_1133.bio: God is his rejector, one of David's thirty-seven distinguished heros (2 Sam. 23:25).

elimelech_1134.name: Elimelech
elimelech_1134.bio: God his king, a man of the tribe of Judah, of the family of the Hezronites, and kinsman of Boaz, who dwelt in Bethlehem in the days of the judges. In consequence of a great dearth he, with his wife Naomi and his two sons, went to dwell in the land of Moab. There he and his sons died (Ruth 1:2, 3; 2:1, 3; 4:3, 9).

elioenai_1135.name: Elioenai (the name of several minor characters in)

elioenai_1136.name: Elioenai (the husband of Naomi. Together they had)

eliphalet_1143.name: Eliphalet
eliphalet_1143.bio: God his deliverance, one of David's sons (2 Sam. 5:16); called also Eliphelet (1 Chr. 3:8).

eliphaz_1144.name: Eliphaz (son of Esau)
eliphaz_1144.bio: The son of Esau by his wife Adah, and father of several Edomitish tribes (Gen. 36:4, 10, 11, 16).

elipheleh_1146.name: Elipheleh
elipheleh_1146.bio: God will distinguish him, one of the porters appointed to play "on the Sheminith" on the occasion of the bringing up of the ark to the city of David (1 Chr. 15:18, 21).

eliphelet_1147.name: Eliphelet (son of Ahasbai)
eliphelet_1147.bio: One of David's distinguished warriors (2 Sam. 23:34); called also Eliphal in 1 Chr. 11:35.

eliphelet_1149.name: Eliphelet (the third)
eliphelet_1149.bio: A descendant of king Saul through Jonathan (1 Chr. 8:39).

elisabeth_1152.name: Elisabeth
elisabeth_1152.bio: God her oath, the mother of John the Baptist (Luke 1:5). She was a descendant of Aaron. She and her husband Zacharias (q.v.) "were both righteous before God" (Luke 1:5, 13).

elisha_1153.name: Elisha
elisha_1153.bio: God his salvation, the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah, who became the attendant and disciple of Elijah (1 Kings 19:16-19). His name first occurs in the command given to Elijah to anoint him as his successor (1 Kings 19:16). This was the only one of the three commands then given to Elijah which he accomplished.

elishah_1154.name: Elishah
elishah_1154.bio: The oldest of the four sons of Javan (Gen. 10:4), whose descendants peopled Greece. It has been supposed that Elishah's descendants peopled the Peloponnesus, which was known by the name of Elis.

elishama_1155.name: Elishama (Dr. Elishama Rosemary Ideh was born in L)
elishama_1155.bio: A prince of Benjamin, grandfather of Joshua (Num. 1:10; 1 Chr. 7:26).

elishama_1157.name: Elishama (Numbers 1:10 from the sons of Joseph: fr)

elishama_1159.name: Elishama (The Priest)
elishama_1159.bio: A priest sent by Jehoshaphat to teach the people the law (2 Chr. 17:8).

elishaphat_1161.name: Elishaphat
elishaphat_1161.bio: Whom God has judged, one of the "captains of hundreds" associated with Jehoiada in the league to overthrow the usurpation of Athaliah (2 Chr. 23:1).

elisheba_1162.name: Elisheba
elisheba_1162.bio: God is her oath, the daughter of Amminadab and the wife of Aaron (Ex. 6:23).

elishua_1163.name: Elishua
elishua_1163.bio: God his salvation, a son of David, 2 Sam. 5:15 = Elishama, 1 Chr. 3:6.

eliud_1164.name: Eliud
children: Eleazar (The Second High Priest. Nephew of Moses)

elizaphan_1189.name: Elizaphan (Name means 'whom God protects'. He's a L)

elkanah_1167.name: Elkanah (Grandson of Korah)
elkanah_1167.bio: The second son of Korah (Ex. 6:24), or, according to 1 Chr. 6:22, 23, more correctly his grandson.

elkanah_1168.name: Elkanah (Prophet of Levi)
elkanah_1168.bio: Another Levite of the line of Heman the singer, although he does not seem to have performed any of the usual Levitical offices. He was father of Samuel the prophet (1 Chr. 6:27, 34).

elkanah_1171.name: Elkanah (Of the Levites)
children: Asa (who lived in the villages of the Netopha)

elkanah_1172.name: Elkanah (The sons of Korah were Assir)

elon_1182.name: Elon (Had multiple wives)
elon_1182.bio: A Hittite, father of Bashemath, Esau's wife (Gen. 26:34).

elon_1183.name: Elon (sons of Zebulun)
elon_1183.bio: One of the sons of Zebulun (Gen. 46:14).

elon_1184.name: Elon (the Zebulunite who led Israel for ten ye)
elon_1184.bio: The eleventh of the Hebrew judges. He held office for ten years (Judg. 12:11, 12).

elpaal_1185.name: Elpaal
children: Shema (who were heads of families of those livi)
Eber (One of the seven heads of the families o)

elymas_403.name: Elymas
elymas_403.bio: magician or sorcerer, the Arabic name of the Jew Bar-jesus, who withstood Paul and Barnabas in Cyprus. He was miraculously struck with blindness ( Acts 13:11 ).

elzabad_1188.name: Elzabad (Korahite Gatekeeper)
parents: Shemaiah (The eldest son of Obed-edom the Gittite.)

enoch_1191.name: Enoch (born Irad)
enoch_1191.bio: The eldest son of Cain (Gen. 4:17), who built a city east of Eden in the land of Nod, and called it "after the name of his son Enoch." This is the first "city" mentioned in Scripture.

enoch_1192.name: Enoch (sons and daughters)
enoch_1192.bio: The son of Jared, and father of Methuselah (Gen. 5:21; Luke 3:37). His father was one hundred and sixty-two years old when he was born.

enos_1193.name: Enos
enos_1193.bio: Man the son of Seth, and grandson of Adam (Gen. 5:6-11; Luke 3:38). He lived nine hundred and five years.

epaenetus_1194.name: Epaenetus
epaenetus_1194.bio: Commendable, a Christian at Rome to whom Paul sent his salutation (Rom. 16:5). He is spoken of as "the first fruits of Achaia" (R.V., "of Asia", i.e., of proconsular Asia, which is probably the correct reading).

epaphras_1195.name: Epaphras
epaphras_1195.bio: Lovely, spoken of by Paul (Col. 1:7; 4:12) as "his dear fellow-servant," and "a faithful minister of Christ." He was thus evidently with him at Rome when he wrote to the Colossians. He was a distinguished disciple, and probably the founder of the Colossian church.

ephah_1199.name: Ephah (The sons of Jahdai)
ephah_1199.bio: 1 Chr. 2:47, a descendant of Judah. Ephah, a word of Egyptian origin, meaning measure; a grain measure containing "three seahs or ten omers," and equivalent to the bath for liquids (Ex.

epher_1201.name: Epher (The sons of Midian were Ephah)
epher_1201.bio: One of the sons of Midian, who was Abraham's son by Keturah (Gen. 25:4).

epher_1203.name: Epher (son of Midian)
epher_1203.bio: The head of one of the families of trans-Jordanic Manasseh who were carried captive by Tiglath-pileser (1 Chr. 5:24).

ephraim_1206.name: Ephraim
ephraim_1206.bio: Double fruitfulness ("for God had made him fruitful in the land of his affliction"). The second son of Joseph, born in Egypt (Gen. 41:52; 46:20).
children: Becher (Also spelled Beker. One of Benjamin’s so)

ephratah_1207.name: Ephratah
ephratah_1207.bio: The second wife of Caleb, the son of Hezron, mother of Hur, and grandmother of Caleb, who was one of those that were sent to spy the land (1 Chr. 2:19, 50).
children: Hur (a companion of Moses and Aaron. He happe)

ephron_1208.name: Ephron
ephron_1208.bio: The son of Zohar a Hittite, the owner of the field and cave of Machpelah (q.v.), which Abraham bought for 400 shekels of silver (Gen. 23:8-17; 25:9; 49:29, 30).

er_1209.name: Er (birth)
parents: Judah (Now will I praise [Heb. odeh] Jehovah)

erastus_1213.name: Erastus
erastus_1213.bio: A companion of Paul at Ephesus, who was sent by him along with Timothy into Macedonia ( Acts 19:22 ). Corinth was his usual place of abode ( 2�Timothy 4:20 ); but probably he may have been the same as the preceding.

esau_1216.name: Esau
esau_1216.bio: Hairy, Rebekah's first-born twin son (Gen. 25:25). The name of Edom, "red", was also given to him from his conduct in connection with the red lentil "pottage" for which he sold his birthright (30, 31).

eshcol_1218.name: Eshcol
eshcol_1218.bio: A young Amoritish chief who joined Abraham in the recovery of Lot from the hands of Chedorlaomer (Gen. 14:13, 24).

esther_1343.name: Esther
esther_1343.bio: The queen of Ahasuerus, and heroine of the book that bears her name. She was a Jewess named Hadas'sah (the myrtle), but when she entered the royal harem she received the name by which she henceforth became known (Esther 2:7). It is a Syro-Arabian modification of the Persian word satarah, which means a star.

ethan_1222.name: Ethan (the Ezrahite)
ethan_1222.bio: "The Ezrahite," distinguished for his wisdom (1 Kings 4:31). He is named as the author of the 89th Psalm. He was of the tribe of Levi.

ethan_1223.name: Ethan (A wise man with whom Solomon is compared)

ethan_1622.name: Ethan (A descendant of Gershom)
ethan_1622.bio: A Levite of the family of Gershom (1 Chr. 6:21), probably the same as Ethan (42).

ethbaal_1225.name: Ethbaal
ethbaal_1225.bio: With Baal, a king of Sidon (B.C. 940-908), father of Jezebel, who was the wife of Ahab (1 Kings 16:31). He is said to have been also a priest of Astarte, whose worship was closely allied to that of Baal, and this may account for his daughter's zeal in promoting idolatry in Israel.

euodias_1229.name: Euodias
euodias_1229.bio: A good journey, a female member of the church at Philippi. She was one who laboured much with Paul in the gospel. He exhorts her to be of one mind with Syntyche (Phil.

eutychus_1230.name: Eutychus
eutychus_1230.bio: fortunate, ( Acts 20:9-12 ), a young man of Troas who fell through drowsiness from the open window of the third floor of the house where Paul was preaching, and was "taken up dead." The lattice-work of the window being open to admit the air, the lad fell out and down to the court below. Paul restored him to life again. (Compare 1�Kings 17:21 ; 2 Kings 4:34 .)

eve_1231.name: Eve
eve_1231.bio: Life; living, the name given by Adam to his wife (Gen. 3:20; 4:1). The account of her creation is given in Gen.

evil-merodach_1233.name: Evil-merodach
evil-merodach_1233.bio: Merodach's man, the son and successor of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon (2 Kings 25:27; Jer. 52:31, 34). He seems to have reigned but two years (B.C.

ezekiel_1237.name: Ezekiel
ezekiel_1237.bio: One of the great prophets, the son of Buzi the priest (Ezek. 1:3). He was one of the Jewish exiles who settled at Tel-Abib, on the banks of the Chebar, "in the land of the Chaldeans." He was probably carried away captive with Jehoiachin (1:2; 2 Kings 24:14-16) about B.C.

ezer_1238.name: Ezer (father of Bilhan)
ezer_1238.bio: One of the sons of Seir, the native princes, "dukes," of Mount Hor (Gen. 36:21, 27).

ezer_1239.name: Ezer (son of Hur)
parents: Hur (a companion of Moses and Aaron. He happe)

ezra_1245.name: Ezra (son of Seraiah)
ezra_1245.bio: The "scribe" who led the second body of exiles that returned from Babylon to Jerusalem B.C. 459, and author of the book of Scripture which bears his name. He was the son, or perhaps grandson, of Seraiah (2 Kings 25:18-21), and a lineal descendant of Phinehas, the son of Aaron (Ezra 7:1-5).

ezra_1246.name: Ezra (the priest)
ezra_1246.bio: A priest among those that returned to Jerusalem under Zerubabel (Neh. 12:1).

ezri_1247.name: Ezri
ezri_1247.bio: Help of Jehovah, the son of Chelub. He superintended, under David, those who "did the work of the field for tillage" (1 Chr. 27:26).
